A chill runs through my body as I face the silent gateway.
It tugs at my mind with menacing persistence.

What 'dark place' is Nada sending me to?
The portal hums and crackles, its dark destination beckoning me forward.

Polo's broadcast has reached across many realities. All Traveler iterations contribute to a cross-reality data pool. Universal progress will unlock <SPECIAL>additional items<> at the Quicksilver Synthesis Bot.
Polo is physically bouncing with emotion, an intense brightness to their eyes - perhaps tears?

It has all led here, friend! The coordinates we've pursued, the strange new seeds in the earth, the dimension-bridging echoes from other traveler-friends. It all aligns! An aftershock, booming through the stars!
Hundreds of thousands of dormant planets, now wakened, yawning, bursting with new discoveries!
I am transmitting coordinates for the epicenter of this galactic upheaval. There is freshly-seeded flora waiting to be discovered - flora of the strangest configuration...
I am transmitting coordinates for the epicenter of this galactic upheaval. There is freshly-birthed fauna waiting to be discovered - fauna of the strangest configuration...

The boundaries are thinnest here, friend. This world will most likely appear anomalous, perhaps broken.
But such potential, such promise!
If every iteration of traveler-friend ventures there, we may be able to consolidate more data than ever before...
How did you find the anomalous new world? Polo and Nada, we envy your travels. Let us see the data?

Astonishing! These findings feel impossibly familiar. As though we dreamt this transmission in another time, or another space...
I believe this journey has only just begun. The data we collect spans iterations other than our own, all funneled into Polo and Nada's humble anomalous home.
My synthetic companion of metal and soul - it stirs! Its processors hunger for data. Come aboard! Look with two of your very own eyes!
This is marvelous data! Do you have more? The anomaly's databanks are wide open, glitching between this universe and the next.

Polo thanks me repeatedly, transferring a gift to my accounts. They quickly assess the display of their tablet device, then confirm that the Synthesis Bot is still responding energetically to the accumulated data. More discoveries would power it further.
Hail us with your scanner, friend, if you have more discoveries to transmit!
This iteration of the Synthesis Bot has almost reached capacity! I think this will be the final batch of data it can accept in this universe.

Friend - this is all the research the anomaly has planned, for now.
But let this not be a moment of sadness! Explore, fly, run, swim, journey!
Will we bring our home to you now, friend?

I find I have no need to access my exosuit's memory banks: Polo's final glyph sequence is scorched bright in the forefront of my mind, committed to my own organic memory.

The energy from the portal feels both hot and cold, both repellant and enticing. A discordant whine sounds, at a frequency almost too high to detect, but I hear it. Some echo from the newborn world beyond.

Find and purchase <SPECIAL>Frigates<> to add them to your fleet. With the aid of the freighter's <TECHNOLOGY>Navigator<>, find profitable expeditions for your fleet.
Expeditions are highly lucrative, and offer the opportunity for rare and exotic rewards.
Expeditions require a Fleet Command Room<>. Construct a Command Post in your freighter. Use the Build Menu (BUILD_MENU<>) in the habitable area between the bridge and the hangar.

A red light fills my vision. All I see is crimson. And then, it fades. The colour drains, and the words that had seemed so clear seem to slip away...
I peer inside the beacon's housing. As well as its distress broadcast unit, it contains a <COMMODITY>Planetary Chart<>.
If I want to get off this planet and find out more about where I am, I'll need to repair my crashed starship. The damage appears to be concentrated around the engine and launch thrusters.

The starship is severely damaged. Repair components from the Inventory<>. Access the Inventory using INVENTORY<>. Repair items using REPAIR<>. Repairs can be carried out in stages<>. The repair is complete when each component is repaired.

Repairing the Pulse Engine requires Hermetic Seal<> and Metal Plating<>. Search for a Hermetic Seal<>. Craft Metal Plating<> from Ferrite Dust<>. Repair items from the Inventory<>. I look inside the distress beacon for additional supplies, more in hope than reason.
And yet, there it is. A replacement <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<>. It does not seem possible that I missed this last time...
I look inside the distress beacon for additional supplies, more in hope than reason. I should investigate the damaged starship that placed this beacon in the first place...
I take the <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<>. I cannot shake the feeling that I am being played with.

Some planets have <FUEL>extreme weather<>. Your Exosuit will warn you when you set foot upon such a world. Hazard levels are much higher on these worlds, and storms are more frequent. <TECHNOLOGY>Hazard Protection Upgrades<> are strongly recommended before exploring such planets.
However, such worlds offer rewards to the brave explorer. <STELLAR>Resource deposits<> are worth considerably more, and you may find <COMMODITY>Storm Crystals<>. These are highly valuable rare resources, and can only be harvested during an active storm.

Friendly faces have been few and far between on my journey so far. Everything I have, I have scavenged for myself.

Ah, Traveller-Entity. The Convergence knows your kind. Welcome.
Another Traveller-Entity. The Convergence will know of this.
The Korvax welcome you, Traveller. May your journey be peaceful.
Hello new friend! Gek welcomes tall Traveller-being to this space station!
Welcome, maybe-friend! Do you have units?
Hello, friend! Are you real friend, or unfriendly unit-thief?
Grah! Interloper! The Vy'keen salute your arrival!
Hah! Puny interloper! How do you hope to do any interloping with such small arms?
Grah! Grah! Grah! The Vy'keen will aid you, interloper!
Lifeform! The guild has no business with strangers! Earn your place.
We are closed to your kind, lifeform. Your units are no good here.
Despite their unfamiliar words, there is something about this alien's manner that implies we have met before. Perhaps they know the one who came before me?
The alien's elegant metallic shell springs to life as I approach. They study me, lights flashing around their visor. Perhaps they know something about the messages left at the base computer?
The metallic being chatters away, pouring forth words in a language I cannot understand. But when I blink, I see that same red light that stared at me at the distress beacon...
The alien squeals as I approach. They seem excited to see me, though I cannot understand their babbling tongue. Perhaps they would recognise the signal mentioned by the base computer?
The alien looks at me expectantly. They are clearing waiting for something. Perhaps they know the one who came before me?
The lifeform chatters away, assessing me with beady, inquisitive eyes. But when I blink, I see that same red light that stared at me at the distress beacon...
The alien, large and intimidating, seems to be attempting to be friendly. Perhaps they know the one who came before me?
The lifeform puffs themself up as I approach, making the most of their impressive size. Perhaps they might recognise the signal mentioned by the base computer?
Despite their size, the alien does not seem aggressive. But when I blink, I see that same red light that stared at me at the distress beacon...
The lifeform pauses before turning away. They either did not hear me, or are choosing to ignore my question.
A glazed look passes over the lifeform's visor. The number has had some strange effect on them. They seem reluctant to speak further.
The code has a strange effect on the lifeform. Their lights freeze, their voice stutters. After a moment, they appear to restart. They do not seem to remember what I said.
A look of surprise crosses the lifeform's face and they release a strange-smelling gas. This appears to signify our conversation is over.
Startled by my question, the lifeform emits a dramatic squeak. Though I do not recognise their words, the shake of their head is unmistakable.
The alien falls silent. I do not know if they understood the code, but my words have clearly had a dramatic impact on them.
The alien draws back, startled. The look on their face tells me our conversation is over.
Hearing the code seems to cause the lifeform to shrink, a look of fear crossing their face. And then, in an instant, the fear passes. They look at me strangely, but say nothing more.
The alien's stance changes. They are not hostile, but their helpful demeanor has vanished. They clearly have no interest in hearing this code.
The lifeform waits behind their terminal. They look me up and down and seem to decide I am not a customer. They do not look particularly helpful.
This lifeform clearly occupies an important position in this station. At first glance, they do not seem particularly interested in me. Perhaps the code will change their mind.
The lifeform looks at me with alarm before waving me away.
No look of recognition passes across the lifeform's face. We continue to misunderstand each other.
You will find us, Traveller. Nada sends their best wishes.
Specialist Polo sends their greetings, Traveller-Friend. You will find us soon.
The Anomaly is coming, Traveller. We will find you, you will find us. You are first.
The lifeform stares at me, silent. When I blink, I see that same red light that stared at me at the terminal. I feel compelled to repeat the code I heard at the signal repeater.
SLASH<> We are<> watching you<>, Traveller-friend. SLASH<> Find<> what we<> have left<> you SLASH<>

Though the alien speaks, the words are not their own. A string of code is echoed back to me through the red glare, logged directly to my Exosuit.
The crimson light fades away, and I see the lifeform staring at me through its visor. Whatever has happened, they do not appear to have seen it.
I should leave. Perhaps my <TECHNOLOGY>Base Computer<> would be able to make something of this code?

Though the alien speaks, the words are not their own. A string of code is echoed back to me through the red glare, logged directly to my Exosuit.
The crimson light fades away, and I see the lifeform blinking at me expectantly. Whatever has happened, they do not appear to have seen it.
I should leave. Perhaps my <TECHNOLOGY>Base Computer<> would be able to make something of this code?

Though the alien speaks, the words are not their own. A string of code is echoed back to me through the red glare, logged directly to my Exosuit.
The crimson light fades away, and I see the lifeform glaring at me. Whatever has happened, they do not appear to have witnessed it.
I should leave. Perhaps my <TECHNOLOGY>Base Computer<> would be able to make something of this code?

The lifeform looks at me, traces of fear and surprise behind their eyes. It is clear they have nothing more to say to me.
No, Traveller. We do not speak of it. We do not speak of it.
Follow the mysterious signal to learn more.
The trail has gone cold. Enquire about the strange signals at the <COMMODITY>Space Station<>.

The lifeform in the space station had a strange reaction to hearing the code. Their eyes glazed over, as if in a trance.
The lifeform marked a location on a nearby planet. Perhaps the answers will be there...

Harvest Carbon<> from plants using the Mining Laser<>. Fire the laser with ATTACK<>. WARNING: Excess harvesting may attract attention from Sentinel drones.

Condensed Carbon<> is found in crystal form on most planets. Locate carbon crystals with the Scanner<> (SCAN<>). Large deposits may require use of an Advanced Mining Laser<>. Condensed Carbon can be created from Carbon in a Refiner<>.

Oxygen<> can be harvested from red plants found on all planets. Locate oxygen-rich plants with the Scanner<> (SCAN<>). Oxygen can also be gathered from some hazardous plants, as well as identified in general flora with the Analysis Visor<>.
Di-hydrogen<> is found in crystal form on most planets. Locate di-hydrogen crystals with the Scanner<> (SCAN<>). Large deposits may require use of an Advanced Mining Laser<>.

Create <TECHNOLOGY>Deuterium<> by processing <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<> in a <TECHNOLOGY>Medium<> or <TECHNOLOGY>Large Refiner<>.
Two separate di-hydrogen inputs are required.
<VAL_ON>Tritium<> is abundant in asteroid fields. Find asteroid fields in rings around planets or at intervals in interstellar flight.
Extract from the earth of any planet with a <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<>.
Harvest Ferrite Dust<> from small rocks using the Mining Laser<>. Fire the laser with ATTACK<>. WARNING: Excess harvesting may attract attention from Sentinel drones.

Create <EARTH>Pure Ferrite<> in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> by processing ferrite dust.
Some large rocks can be mined for Pure Ferrite directly with an <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.
Create <EARTH>Magnetized Ferrite<> in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> by processing pure ferrite.
Sodium<> is harvested from yellow plants found on all planets. Locate sodium-rich plants with the Scanner<> (SCAN<>).

Sodium Nitrate<> is created from Sodium in a Refiner<> Sodium Nitrate is also found in crystal form. Locate sodium nitrate crystals with the Scanner<> (SCAN<>). Mining requires use of an Advanced Mining Laser<>.

<TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<> is readily extracted from <EARTH>subterranean rock deposits<>.
Locate natural cave entrances. <RED>WARNING:<> many caves contain hazardous flora.

<TECHNOLOGY>Ionized Cobalt<> is created from Cobalt in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>. Locate Cobalt underground.
Locate natural cave entrances. <RED>WARNING:<> many caves contain hazardous flora.

<TRADEABLE>Salt<> is readily extracted from <EARTH>underwater rock deposits<>.
Increase marine efficiency by upgrading the Exosuit <TECHNOLOGY>Aeration Membrane<> or by refilling oxygen supplies from <TRADEABLE>Kelp Sacs<>.

<TRADEABLE>Chlorine<> is created from Salt in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>.
Chlorine can be mined directly from large underwater deposits. Mining requires use of an <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.

<STELLAR>Copper<> is mined from large deposits using the <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<>.
Find copper deposits with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Copper deposits are found on planets orbiting <STELLAR>yellow stars<>.

<STELLAR>Cadmium<> is mined from large deposits using the <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<>.
Find cadmium deposits with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Cadmium deposits are found on planets orbiting <FUEL>red stars<>.

<STELLAR>Emeril<> is mined from large deposits using the <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<>.
Find emeril deposits with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Emeril deposits are found on planets orbiting <TRADEABLE>green stars<>.

<STELLAR>Indium<> is mined from large deposits using the <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<>.
Find indium deposits with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Indium deposits are found on planets orbiting <TECHNOLOGY>blue stars<>.

<SPECIAL>Chromatic Metal<> is created in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> from the <STELLAR>stellar metals<>: <COMMODITY>Copper<>, <FUEL>Cadmium<>, <TRADEABLE>Emeril<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Indium<>.
The <SPECIAL>rarer<> the stellar metal, the more Chromatic Metal it will produce. Find stellar metal deposits on planets using the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.
A strange and potent substance, <TECHNOLOGY>nanite clusters<> are found where the boundaries of the universe weaken. Seek <VAL_ON>abandoned buildings<> and other sites of interest.

<EARTH>Paraffinium<> is found primarily on worlds with a <TRADEABLE>tropical environment<>. Typically found in large deposits and located with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.
Common ferrite rocks may yield Paraffinium after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Can be <TECHNOLOGY>refined<> from other terrain elements.

<EARTH>Pyrite<> is found primarily on worlds with a <FUEL>desert environment<>. Typically found in large deposits and located with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.
Common ferrite rocks may yield Pyrite after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Can be <TECHNOLOGY>refined<> from other terrain elements.

<EARTH>Ammonia<> is found primarily on worlds with a <TRADEABLE>toxic environment<>. Typically found in large deposits and located with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.
Common ferrite rocks may yield Ammonia after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Can be <TECHNOLOGY>refined<> from other terrain elements.

<EARTH>Uranium<> is found primarily on worlds with a <COMMODITY>radioactive environment<>. Typically found in large deposits and located with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.
Common ferrite rocks may yield Uranium after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Can be <TECHNOLOGY>refined<> from other terrain elements.

<EARTH>Dioxite<> is found primarily on worlds with a <TECHNOLOGY>frozen environment<>. Typically found in large deposits and located with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.
Common ferrite rocks may yield Dioxite after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Can be <TECHNOLOGY>refined<> from other terrain metals.

<EARTH>Phosphorus<> is found primarily on worlds with a <FUEL>scorched environment<>. Typically found in large deposits and located with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.
Common ferrite rocks may yield Phosphorus after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>. Can be <TECHNOLOGY>refined<> from other terrain metals.

<SPECIAL>Mordite<> is a gelatinous organic material harvested from the corpses of living beings. Extraction involves the death of the organism.
It is possible to grow mordite given the right environment and correct host plant. Seek advice from an <TRADEABLE>Agricultural Specialist<>.
A dark, liquid glass, <SPECIAL>Pugneum<> is extracted from the remains of <SPECIAL>Sentinels<>. Engage Sentinel forces in combat to release Pugneum from their shells.
<EARTH>Silver<> is a valuable interstellar trading mineral, most commonly <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.
<STELLAR>Gold<> is a valuable interstellar trading mineral, most commonly <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.
<EARTH>Platinum<> is a rare interstellar trading mineral, <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Very occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

<TRADEABLE>Sulphurine<> is a pungent atmospheric <TRADEABLE>gas<>. High concentrations are extremely hazardous to organic life.
With the aid of an <TECHNOLOGY>Atmosphere Harvester<>, can be extracted from the atmospheres of <FUEL>Scorched<> and <SPECIAL>Barren<> planets.

<TRADEABLE>Radon<> is a colorless, odorless <TRADEABLE>gas<> with a relatively short half-life. 
With the aid of an <TECHNOLOGY>Atmosphere Harvester<>, can be extracted from the atmospheres of <COMMODITY>Radioactive<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Frozen<> planets.

<TRADEABLE>Nitrogen<> is a reactive atmospheric <TRADEABLE>gas<> found wherever there is organic life.
With the aid of an <TECHNOLOGY>Atmosphere Harvester<>, can be extracted from the atmospheres of <TRADEABLE>Lush<> and <TRADEABLE>Toxic<> planets.

<STELLAR>Activated Copper<> is created by the harsh environmental conditions on <FUEL>Extreme Weather Planets<>.

<STELLAR>Activated Cadmium<> is created by the harsh environmental conditions on <FUEL>Extreme Weather Planets<>.

Locate creatures on a planet's surface.
Use the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<> to locate creatures. <FUEL>Red<> dots indicate undiscovered species, whilst <TRADEABLE>green<> dots track species that have already been registered with the Analysis Visor.
Creatures have specific diets. Different species will consume different elements.
Fed creatures may reward those who aid them.
The client is a wealthy philanthropist with an interest in wildlife conservation.
The client is an exobiologist. They are hoping to learn more about the gut bacteria of local fauna.
The client has requested a degree of discretion, as they have recently inherited a substantial fortune.
The client is deeply concerned about the future of local ecosystems.
The client shuns conventional company, preferring the company of non-bipeds. They seek an explorer with a similar attitude.
The client runs an agricultural business in the local system.
The client runs a popular zoological institute in the local system.
The client owns a substantial industrial network, based on the processing of animal byproducts.
The client feels a deep and meaningful connection to all living things.
The client has requested that they are not identified.
The client has a long history of independent research into local wildlife populations.
The client is a respected authority on the wildlife and general ecosystem of the local area.
They have a great deal of affection for the species that inhabit this system, and would like to see them taken care of.
They are deeply troubled by the disruption caused to wildlife by local planetary construction.
They would like to increase the nutrient supply available to local creatures, with the hope that this leads to a general fattening of the population.
They wish to conduct an experiment, hoping to inform future activity. Are there any adverse effects from interfering in planetary food chains?
They seek a large volume of excrement, and are prepared to pay well to acquire it.
They hope to improve the soil condition of local worlds without resorting to artificial fertilizers. As such, they hope to stimulate manure production.
They feel a sense of shame for an act in their past, and hope to atone for their mistakes by improving the lives of other species.
The client seeks little more than a peaceful resolution to the constant consumption of their crops by nearby creatures.
They seek immediate remedies to the dramatic decline in local wildlife.
They are going through a period of mourning, after the loss of a beloved family pet. They seek to alleviate their suffering by commissioning good works.
They hope to spread wildflower seeds, beautifying their planet. They hope do so via the manure of migrating animals.
They feel a particular affection for the gentle herbivores that graze the local system, and would see them taken care of.
They would like an explorer to feed any creatures they find. They will pay handsomely, but request the explorer provides their own food supplies.
They request an explorer to live among wildlife and ensure they are fed.
They will pay any explorer who feeds the local wildlife. In the spirit of ecosystem balance, the client asks that the explorer avoids taming any of the creatures.
They ask that an explorer collects food samples and distributes them amongst local herds.
They request an explorer with excellent pathogen-avoidance protocols finds a nearby herd and begins the feeding process.
They seek an explorer to feed local wildlife, while taking care not to introduce any invasive species that might disrupt the ecosystem.
They seek a ecologically-minded explorer to observe the eating habits of local creatures, and then ensure that they are well-fed.
They invite explorers to feed local creatures, in exchange for a handsome reward. The client notes that the explorer is free to keep any useful fluids generated in the course of their work.
The client wishes for an explorer to feed local creatures. They ask any prospective explorers to note that safety gloves will not be provided.
They will reward any explorer who feeds local wildlife. However, they caution against becoming emotionally involved with the subjects of this mission.
They will pay any explorer who helps them spread food among local creature populations. Please note: the client cautions that feeding creatures from existing commercial herds is not sufficient.

The client will pay for each creature fed. They request any potential explorers feed only herbivores, and note that they will not pay compensation in the event of hungry creatures consuming any part of the explorer.

The client operates a large educational institute in this system. They seek ancient artifacts for their collection.
The client is an outcast, shunned by their contemporaries for their beliefs about the past.
The client comes from a wealthy family, and wishes to learn more about their lineage.
The client has been studying the Sentinels for many years, and hopes to make a breakthrough by looking to the past.
The client has a particular interest in novel pathogens. They believe there is an untapped well of disease lurking in the distant past.
The client hopes to understand the technology of the past, with the aim of improving the technology of the future.
The client had to flee their homeworld after an environmental catastrophe. They hope to understand the roots of this disaster by examining the past.
The client has recently discovered a priceless family heirloom. They seek similar artifacts, so that they might understand their own history in context.
The client has learned a disturbing fact about their ancestry and seeks clarification about the past.
The client has been studying the history of our common ancestor and seeks help in gathering new source material.
The client is worried that civilization may be heading towards a collapse. Through study, they hope to avoid the mistakes of the past.

The client believes they have found an ancient genetic link between the Gek and the Vy'keen. Such information could prove politically destabilizing, so they seek additional proof from the fossil records.
The client is a keen student of the past, and they hope to make a name for themselves at the local historical society.
The client is interested in ancient ruins and their contents. They do not believe the ruins were built by proto-Gek, nor ancient Vy'keen. They seek artifacts to help prove their thesis.
The client is tired of modern life. They seek fragments of the past, so that they might reconstruct the superior culture of our forebears.
The client is a 'medical' researcher with a keen interest in how chemicals are absorbed by the gut. They seek ancient ruins, hoping to collect samples of things eaten by those now long dead.
The client operates a moderately successful mining company. They are seeking to diversify their operation, and wish to test the viability of commercial-scale archaeology.
They are particularly interested in written records from the distant past. The data is sufficient: they do not need the physical source.
They require relics of all types. The pieces will be scanned and the records entered into their personal database.
They seek explorers to aid them. Any unearthed artifacts will belong to the discoverer - they only ask for scan data or digital copies of the sample.
They are particularly keen to recover scans of any ancient cultural artifacts. Once recorded, the field agent is free to keep the physical sample.
There are large gaps in their historical records, and they seek field agents for archaeological expeditions to fill in this missing data.
They will independently verify any data. Those attempting to pass new objects as ancient will be reported to the relevant authorities.
The client has requested only artifacts over 100 years old. New samples will be automatically rejected.
The client notes that relics of the Korvax are accepted but not preferred.
The client requests that the field agent supplies their own spade and / or other supplementary digging equipment.
The client accepts no liability for any ancient curses that may afflict the field agent during the commission.
The client accepts no liability should the field agent become trapped in a hole, a pit or any other excavation during the course of the commission.
The client advises that pirates in this system have recently entered the artifact market, and that field agents should take appropriate caution.
The client advises the field agent to show discretion in this matter and not to give away the location of any digsites to less scrupulous relic-hunters.
The client notes that responsibility for any diseases or other terrors unleashed from the deep will fall entirely on the field agent.
The client requests that any fieldwork is done carefully and avoids damaging any ancient architecture.
I met a lifeform on planet %PLANET% who requested my assistance.
A lifeform on planet %PLANET% has asked for my help.
While exploring planet %PLANET%, I came across a lifeform in need.
A lifeform on planet %PLANET% asked for my help in resolving a situation.
I met a lifeform in need on planet %PLANET%.
Return to your ship and fly to space
<FUEL>WARNING: <> Mission is local and will end automatically on warp.

They claim that their facility is subject to constant pirate harassment. It appears they have neither the means to defend themselves, nor the ability to leave their station.

They offer a substantial reward to any who might bring this bombardment to an end...

They claim to require detailed scans of the creatures who live on this planet. They have not been clear as to what they will do with this data.

However, they have made it very clear that I will be rewarded handsomely should I assist them in collecting the data.

They claim to be in desperate need of detailed scans of the flora that grows in this system. They attempted to explain why, but their meaning was not clear.

It is apparent that I will be rewarded handsomely should I assist them in collecting the data.

Much of what they said was difficult to understand. It seems that they require geological data, probes of the minerals that litter this system.

Despite the translation issues, one thing was clear: there is a substantial reward on offer for any explorer who supplies this data.

They seemed possessed of a real anger, a hatred towards the Sentinels that swarm across their planet. The lifeform was unable to leave their post, but offered to reward me should I find and destroy Sentinel forces.

They seemed afraid, whispering incomprehensible warnings. I was able to understand only enough to know that they thought strange monstrosities were stalking their world, and that they would reward me should I find and kill these fiends.

The lifeform seemed bored, tired of their life locked away inside their outpost. They mentioned something about the smell of mordite.

The conversation was difficult to track, but they appear to want me to hunt for them. They offered a substantial reward should I venture out and kill the creatures that roam this world.

They spoke to me of their love of the outside world, of how much it pained them to be locked away inside. They related some long and difficult to follow tale of a small creature that appeared to be their pet.

They seem to be offering me a large reward should I wander the planet and feed any wild animals I come across.

They babbled excitedly, talking of some ancient ruin that showed great promise. They showed me their data, the clue that had put them on the trail of this artifact.

They are not able to go looking for it themselves, so request that I do so on their behalf. They say I will be able to keep the artifact for myself, as long as I log any important historical discoveries in their name.

They seemed agitated, in great need of a particular substance. For reasons I do not understand, they are unable to leave their post to collect it for themselves.

They have offered a generous reward should I collect it on their behalf and return it to their outpost.

They have an item they claim needs delivering, but they are unable to make the journey themselves. They seem afraid of something, though I was not able to determine exactly what.

They have offered a substantial reward should I successfully make the delivery on their behalf.

They babbled a set of coordinates, pointing excitedly at a map. They seem to have identified a resource depot. For reasons I did not understand, they seem excited at the prospect of this depot being destroyed.

They offer me a generous payment should I destroy this depot for them.

They talked to me in serious tones, pointing out a nearby factory. Something about this installation has troubled them deeply, for it seems they want it raided.

The lifeform offered a substantial reward should I infiltrate the facility and access its data banks. They warn me to expect the Sentinels to respond with force.

It was difficult to understand their exact meaning, but it seems as if a colleague of theirs has gone missing. They are distressed, and seek help in tracking them down.

They offer me a large reward should I help them locate their missing 'friend'.
Return to the Nexus to receive your reward. Summon the Space Anomaly from the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>) when in space.
Return to the Nexus to receive your reward. Summon the Space Anomaly from the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>) when in space.
Return to the lifeform to notify them of your success and receive your reward.

Return to the lifeform
Find the lifeform at their outpost
Return to the Guild Envoy aboard the space station to notify them of your success and receive your reward.

Find a Guild Envoy aboard a space station
The lifeform's mask flashes a repeated pattern. They gesture towards their manifest, as if to recruit me for some task.
The alien's pheromones fill the room with a scent designed to put me at ease. They seem to have some task they require help with...
Though the alien is intimidating to say the least, the stance is not one of aggression. Indeed, they appear to be asking for my help...
Wandering entity, the Convergence seeks your assistance. Travel where we cannot.
Traveller. Korvax sees what you are. Aid Korvax, and Korvax will aid you.
Through the Convergence, Korvax travels to all places. But shell entity requires assistance.
All who come through doors are friend! You will help, yes?
Friend looks brave and strong! Friend will help the Gek, yes? All friends here?
Friend, I offer you a trade. Exciting rewards for exciting work! Yes?
Grah! Interloper! I will forgive your intrusion if you help me.
Site is Vy'keen only! Prove your worth, interloper!
Grah! Your Multi-Tool is pleasing, interloper! Do you wish to use it?
The lifeform's visor flashes once more. I cannot read their reaction. I shall have to complete their task to learn more.
The lifeform hops about, happy. They wave, as if to wish me good luck.
The alien grunts at me, and makes an unimpressed gesture of thanks. They turn, almost as if they do not expect to see me again.
The Korvax makes a gesture of thanks. They scan me briefly, making a note in their records. Bookkeeping complete, they present me with a reward.
The Gek chatters excitedly. They give me my reward, completing our deal.
The Vy'keen salutes as I leave. I have gained their respect.
The Traveller entity returns, with the aura of success. Your report?
Friend! You live! Happy happy day! You bring good news?
Grah! You returned in glory, interloper?

Ah, Traveler-Entity. Korvax is pleased to report exciting navigational research! Korvax has plotted <COMMODITY>new expeditions<> for your fleet!
Hello, Captain-Friend! Joyous day for the fleet! I have charted <COMMODITY>new expedition routes!<>
Grah! Interloper-Captain! There is fresh glory available for the fleet! I have charted <COMMODITY>new expedition routes!<> Prepare for triumph!
Korvax has prepared routes for the fleet, Traveler. Which route do you feel is most promising?
Captain-Friend! I have been most busy plotting routes for your fleet! Please enjoy them!
Grah! I have plotted many routes, interloper! Make your choice!
Korvax has calculated all possible expedition routes. The ones I offer you are those with the lowest probability of total destruction.
I have charted these most joyous routes for you, Captain-Friend! May they bring many units to your fleet!
All these routes offer glory and triumph for the fleet, Traveler! Grah!
Korvax has been busy preparing routes. I have calculated the following hyperspace coordinate paths as both highly profitable and unlikely to confuse weaker navigators.
Trade expeditions are the best expeditions, Traveler-Friend. But I hope all routes I chart will bring you happiness.
I have prepared the requisite charts. Are you ready to dispatch the fleet, interloper-Captain? May they bring glory to us all!
Korvax has mapped all known stars in this region of space. The following routes have been optimized for successful fleet operations.
I have charted routes for you fleet, Captain-Friend! They offer great opportunities, as well as lovely views!
The charts are ready, interloper-Captain! Have you briefed the fleet? Are they ready for battle? Grah!
Korvax has used the knowledge of the Convergence to chart these routes for your fleet, Traveler-Entity. May you find them close to perfection.
Captain-Friend, your Navigator-Friend has been hard at work! I have charted many expeditions for your fleet!
Grah! Behold my work, interloper-Captain! Charts and maps, each route dripping with potential glory!
Korvax is pleased to calculate routes for the Traveler-Captain. But the fleet requires a  <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Command Room<> before it can depart.
Happy day, Captain-Friend! We will plan many expeditions together! But first, you must build a <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Command Room<>, so that you may talk to your fleet as they sail!
Grah! Interloper-Captain! Our ship lacks a <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Command Room!<> We cannot possibly dispatch expeditions in this state!
Korvax is pleased to calculate routes for the Traveler-Captain. But all your  <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Command Rooms<> are busy. You must construct more, or await the return of your fleet.
Captain-Friend! I am excited to share my routes with you! But all of our <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Command Rooms<> are in use. We must build more if we wish to plan new ventures!
Grah! Interloper-Captain! All of our <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Command Rooms<> are busy. We cannot possibly dispatch expeditions in this state! Construct more, if you wish to expand your command!
%NAME% has prepared an expedition for my fleet. But my freighter lacks the <TECHNOLOGY>Fleet Command Room<> I need to maintain communications during the voyage.
No Expedition Assigned. Fleet Command Standing By...

%CAP_RACE%, our artifact scanner is at full power! On your command, I will target the systems at nearby planet and begin the scan.
%CAP_RACE%, welcome aboard. I regret to inform you that the artifact scanner is still accumulating energy. I will be happy to deploy it for you as soon as it is ready.
Welcome aboard %CAP_RACE%. I am pleased to report local trade scouts have secured favorable deals across the system. The profits await you.
Welcome, %CAP_RACE%. The scouts are currently deployed on trade missions across the local system. I shall report any profitable news as I have it.
%CAP_RACE%, the crew have been busy surveying and processing both planetary deposits and local asteroids. The minerals are yours, should you want them.
Welcome aboard %CAP_RACE%. The planetary mining crew are currently deployed on mission. I hope to receive news of a successful operation very soon.
%CAP_RACE%! Welcome! Our weapon systems are armed, our fighters ready to scramble. We are at your command!
A status report, %CAP_RACE%. The generator units are at optimal load and the supply tanks are full. We have prepared the leftover fuel cells for your own personal use.
Fuel generation units are running at maximum efficiency, %CAP_RACE%! The supply tanks will soon be full, ready for deployment to the fleet.
Friend! I am pursuing new hybrid plants! It is such fun. Will you help me birth new life? I require considerable plant samples to graft and to splice, more than I can grow myself.
Have you reconsidered, friend? Will you help my grow my little garden?
Wonderful, Traveler-Friend! Oh, the new plants we'll discover. I can already see them in my mind!
Can you feel it, Traveler? The pulse of life, beating through the soil!
Plants are generous, Traveler-Friend. They do not horde life to themselves, but give it freely to others! They mingle their stems, provide us their fruit, and even in death they nourish the soil.
Are you never tempted to push your hands deep into the dirt? If you close your eyes, you can almost imagine the loam consuming you entirely...
Have you gathered the samples, friend? Please say you have!
Oh, wonderful! I have news for you as well - my latest creation has sprouted! It has produced the most interesting of seeds. Please, take a sample.
No matter, Traveler. We will continue to grow together for many years to come.
This is more than enough for today, friend! But tomorrow - tomorrow brings new sunlight and new plants to study!
%NAME% laughs, amused by the absurdity of my question.
%NAME% smiles, happy to be here among their plants.

Traveler, you gather data as you explore, do you not? I find myself hungry for information, for details of the world beyond!
My current research requires animal behavioral data. Would you be able to assist?
Have you gathered the requisite zoological data, Traveler?

Traveler, you gather data as you explore, do you not? I find myself hungry for information, for details of the world beyond!
My current research requires detailed floral studies. Would you be able to assist?
Have you gathered the requisite botanical data, Traveler?

Traveler, you gather data as you explore, do you not? I find myself hungry for information, for details of the world beyond!
My current research requires fine-grained mineral analysis. Would you be able to assist?
Have you gathered the requisite geological data, Traveler?

Traveler, you gather data as you explore, do you not? I find myself hungry for information, for details of the world beyond!
My current research requires high-level scans of many different planets. Would you be able to assist?
Have you gathered the requisite celestial data, Traveler?
Eheu! Perfect, Traveler! This will greatly aid my research. Please, take these <TECHNOLOGY>Nanites<> as compensation for your work.

Though my needs are met, Traveler, there is still an infinity of wonder out there to discover and harvest!
Once I have processed this data, I may find additional tasks for you to help with.

My research is highly complex, Traveler. I doubt you would understand. You see, if I input enough of this gathered data into my simulation, then -
No, it is not worth explaining. But your interest is noted, with thanks.

Traveler-Friend, you taunt me each time you enter and leave this 'home' of ours. You see the world, and all I see is the world of glass...
Grant me some small comfort, Traveler. Collect images of the places you visit, so that my eyes may follow yours.
I am bound to this place, Traveler-Friend. Grant me the joy of seeing the world through your lens.

I have already taken the liberty of loading the image requirements into your Multi-Tool, Traveler-Friend.
Take care...
I will wait out my days here, until I am reborn again. Until we repeat all this, in a world beyond these worlds... As I repeat myself, even now!
The Gek does not react to my touch, and I do not let it linger.
Their presence is unnerving, but I feel it better that the Overseer remains here, where I can see them.
You have been far afield, Traveler. I can sense it...

What a comfort to these eyes of glass, Traveler-Friend! The base is full of joy today!
Here, take these crumbs as a token of my appreciation...
You cannot withhold these things from me, Traveler-Friend.

I have seen enough for today, Traveler-Friend. One wouldn't want to run out of things to see, after all...
Perhaps we shall re-perform this loop tomorrow?

As I stare, I feel a dull crimson ache spread behind my eyes. But I will not look away.
Eventually, I blink. The Overseer is still there, still staring back.
I will see you tomorrow, Traveler-Friend.
Traveler, I have detected another location of interest! Go, that you may hone your control of the Exocraft! Track the signal down before it disappears, so that we may siphon its units!
You are still interested in my work, Traveler? That is a relief!
Hurry, Traveler! I can only maintain the connection for so long!
Grah! What are you waiting for, Traveler? Do you want my work to go to waste?

Grah! But - 
You are your own master, Traveler. I will not force you to do anything.

They spend their days doing this now, tending to the Exocraft and drawing data from interplanetary networks. Sometimes I see them walking out into the planet itself to explore, but such times are rare. 

The technician is content with this retirement, engaging in its fugitive activity for the pleasure of the chase, no longer for the necessity of survival. It is a game we can repeat, one last heist after one last heist...
There is little activity on the network, Traveler. Perhaps we can try again tomorrow.
The technician looks me in the eye. It is faint and far away, but I almost detect a smile.
The technician barely reacts to my departure. As always, it seems there are other things on their mind.
Grah! Traveler, I have been inspired by your actions to craft a <TECHNOLOGY>Multi-Tool<> of great power! Would it please you to examine it?
You wish to examine my <TECHNOLOGY>Multi-Tool<>, Traveler? Very wise! For it is a product of its time, and I will soon begin work on a new model.
Very well, Traveler. But my work is fast and my inspiration fleeting - I will soon begin work on a new specimen, and this one will not be lost to history!
Are you enjoying your new Multi-Tool, Traveler? May it flay your enemies, and gather you both glory and riches!
Grah! It will incinerate all who oppose you!
Grah! It is a fine tool, engineered with the utmost care!

My farmer continues to find happiness in the soil. They research new crop samples daily, and will share the results with me. They only ask that I keep myself in the botanical mindset through farming efforts of my own.

The farmer seeks a fresh sample from a particular plant.
Collect samples from <TRADEABLE>farmed crops<> in your planetary base or freighter, or collect samples directly in the wild.
Wild samples require visiting specific planet types.

Collect %ITEM%: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT%
Harvest from farmed plants or find samples in the wild
Wild samples only grow in specific planetary biomes
The Overseer has requested I use my camera to capture images of various worlds. They tire of the limits imposed by my base, and long for whatever freedom they can find.
Take a photo for the Overseer.
The Overseer requires photos of specific worlds. Learn information about planets from space by using the Ship Scanner<> (SHIPSCAN<>).
The Technician has found a way to unlock more terminals. They will only stay open for a limited time, so I will have to hurry if I hope to collect the items.
The Technician has opened a link at a nearby terminal. Retrieve the items before the timer expires.

The stone resonates, producing a sound that fills my mind. A vision begins to take shape...
A robotic lifeform turns towards me. Light steams from their metal shell, forming a glowing fog that surrounds us both. They gesture towards me...

The stone resonates, producing a sound that fills my mind. A vision begins to take shape...
A small alien lifeform kneels before me. They are tired, beaten. Without meeting my gaze, they offer up their hand...

The stone resonates, producing a sound that fills my mind. A vision begins to take shape...
I see two large aliens locked in combat. Eventually, one triumphs, leaving their victim to bleed to death. With the last of their strength, the vanquished alien gestures towards me...

TERMINAL ONLINE...
Universal Translation Service reached. Lifeform dictionary available.
The name <TECHNOLOGY>'Korvax'<> floats in my vision, an echo of the strange vision I just experienced. A word in this alien tongue is seared into my brain.
The name <COMMODITY>'Gek'<> floats in my vision, an echo of the strange vision I just experienced. A word in this alien tongue is seared into my brain.
The name <FUEL>'Vy'keen'<> floats in my vision, an echo of the strange vision I just experienced. A word in this alien tongue is seared into my brain.
The Vy'keen takes a break from their maintenance of the <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Terminal<>. They stare at me, as if slightly disturbed by my presence.
The Gek, clearly the <CATALYST>Overseer<> of this base, looks me in the eye in a most disturbing way. It feels like they are trying to tell me something, although I cannot grasp what.
The Gek looks at me with alarm. They appear to recognize me, though I do not know where from. They quickly return to the comfort of their <TRADEABLE>Farming Terminal<>.

The Korvax tilts their head as I approach. I feel their visor begin its scan, but whatever data is returned is not to their satisfaction. They return to their business at the <TECHNOLOGY>Science Terminal<> and ignore me.
The Vy'keen prepares to salute my arrival, but then stops themselves. They look at me, mildly puzzled, before returning to their work at the <FUEL>Weapons Terminal<>.

A supremely powerful<> upgrade for the Infra-Knife Accelerator<>. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin upgrade installation process<>. The module is flexible, and exact upgrade statistics are unknown<> until installation is complete. Potential improvements include: damage output<>, fire rate<> and overheat times<>.

A significant<> upgrade for the Cyclotron Ballista<>. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin upgrade installation process<>. The module is flexible, and exact upgrade statistics are unknown<> until installation is complete. Potential improvements include: damage output<>, fire rate<> and overheat times<>.

An extremely powerful<> upgrade for the Cyclotron Ballista<>. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin upgrade installation process<>. The module is flexible, and exact upgrade statistics are unknown<> until installation is complete. Potential improvements include: damage output<>, fire rate<> and overheat times<>.

A supremely powerful<> upgrade for the Cyclotron Ballista<>. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin upgrade installation process<>. The module is flexible, and exact upgrade statistics are unknown<> until installation is complete. Potential improvements include: damage output<>, fire rate<> and overheat times<>.
Increases the base capacity of the <COMMODITY>Hazard Protection<> system, allowing the user to spend longer in hazardous environments without recharging their Exosuit.
Increases the base capacity of the <FUEL>Life Support<> system, allowing the user to go longer between charges.
Increases the capacity of the Exosuit's <STELLAR>Jetpack Tanks<> and <STELLAR>Adrenal Pump Reserves<>, allowing the user to both fly and sprint longer.
Equips the Exosuit jetpack with advanced jump capabilities<>, allowing the user to take huge leaps with ease. Activate jump systems by rapidly pressing JUMP<>.
Upgrades the starship launch systems, decreasing the <STELLAR>fuel cost<> of takeoff.

Adds a layer of superheated shielding to the starship's defense array, vaporizing incoming fire.

Significantly increases <STELLAR>starship shield performance<>.
Expands the loading chamber of the starship <TECHNOLOGY>Rocket Launcher<>, improving exhaust performance and allowing for significantly faster <STELLAR>heat recovery<>.

Rewires the <TECHNOLOGY>Phase Beam<> with nanite-based circuitry, bypassing conventional reality limits on laser power.

Significantly improves <STELLAR>heat performance<>.

Replaces the conventional <TECHNOLOGY>Photon Cannon<> optics with an experimental glass array, boosting combat performance.

Significantly improves <STELLAR>heat sink capacity<>.

Overhauls the firing mechanism of the <TECHNOLOGY>Positron Ejector<>, resulting in faster, more accurate particles.

Improves <STELLAR>range<> and <STELLAR>accuracy<>.
Upgrades the <TECHNOLOGY>Infra-Knife Accelerator<>, compressing internal waveforms to allow an extra shot to be weaved in to the conventional fire patterns.

Replaces the hint sink of the <TECHNOLOGY>Cyclotron Ballista<> by encompassing the entire unit with a heat-absorbing megastructure. Heat output is recycled to boost combat efficiency.

Significantly improves <STELLAR>heat performance<>.

A powerful lateral processor inserted into the Multi-Tool <TECHNOLOGY>Scanning System<> allows the device to recharge at a significantly improved rate.

Increases <STELLAR>potential scan frequency<>.

Inserts a powerful field ionization device into the barrel of the <TECHNOLOGY>Boltcaster<>, increasing projectile stability through the air.

Improves <STELLAR>device accuracy<> and allows the user to fire for longer periods without degrading combat performance.

Extends the firing chamber of the <TECHNOLOGY>Blaze Javelin<>, allowing the internal particle accelerators to reach both greater mass and speed.

Significantly improves <STELLAR>weapon damage<>.
Advanced self-lubricating components decrease friction within the <TECHNOLOGY>Scatter Blaster<>, offering significant improves to <STELLAR>reload times<>.

Specialist harmonic resonators allow the <TECHNOLOGY>Pulse Spitter<> to split inserted ammunition, effective manufacturing more shots from fewer materials.

Increases <STELLAR>weapon clip size<>.

A significant<> upgrade for the Exocraft Engine<>. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin upgrade installation process<>. The module is flexible, and exact upgrade statistics are unknown<> until installation is complete. Potential improvements include: fuel efficiency<> and/or top speed<>.

An extremely powerful<> upgrade for the Exocraft Engine<>. Use FE_ALT1<><> to begin upgrade installation process<>. The module is flexible, and exact upgrade statistics are unknown<> until installation is complete. Potential improvements include: fuel efficiency<> and/or top speed<>.

My thanks, %CAP_RACE%! We would never have made it without you. We shall repay your assistance with a long and fruitful voyage!
An excellent display, %CAP_RACE%! It was an honor to have you fight alongside us. When we next meet again, we shall have completed our expedition - and brought you much glory in return!
Truly inspiring, %CAP_RACE%! The crew have taken great heart from your performance. We look forward to seeing you again, when our voyage is complete.
%NAME% says nothing, but salutes as they end their message.

%CAP_RACE%! We require immediate assistance!
The fleet is being stalked by enemy starships. All attempts to escape have failed. But if you were able to distract them, we might be able to turn the situation to our advantage...
I reassure the fleet commander. I will head to their location as quickly as possible.
I tell the fleet commander to trust their ships and their crew. Deploy their ships and charge the warp drive - the pirates will not be able to follow them to the next system.
Under fire in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% directly intervened, ambushing our attackers. All targets destroyed, substantial bounty claimed.
Under fire in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% directly intervened, but was unable to divert pirate attack.
Stalked by pirate vessels in %SYSTEM% System. Deployed emergency shields on advice of the %CAP_RACE%, warped out to safety.
Unfortunate news, %CAP_RACE%. The fleet is cornered. Our main weapons have been disabled. We face imminent destruction! You must help us!
Very well. I shall not mention this conversation to the crew.
Fleet faced imminent destruction at the hands of %RACE% pirates in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% intervened directly and rescued us from certain death. Bounties claimed.
Sabotaged by %RACE% spies in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% unable to assist. Catastrophic damage to the fleet.
Sabotaged by %RACE% spies in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% unable to assist. Main guns disabled. Split the fleet to distract hostiles. Miracle warp navigation allowed unlikely escape.
%CAP_RACE%! ... comms... explosion... lost... pirates... surrounded... help!
I tell the fleet commander that I will come to their aid. I do not know if they can hear me, but I try to sound reassuring. The ruptured nature of their message does not fill me with hope.
The hiss and garble of the communicator falls silent. I cannot help the fleet now. Their fate is in their own hands.
Entered %SYSTEM% Sector. Surprise attack by %RACE% pirates disabled bridge electronics. %CAP_RACE% assisted fleet in destroying all hostiles. Bounties claimed.
Transmitter... %PLANET%... avoided serious... attempting... restart... %SYSTEM% sector...
%CAP_RACE%, we have been tracking a pirate fleet across several sectors. We have them cornered! Honor us with your presence as we begin the engagement!
We shall keep them surrounded until you arrive, %CAP_RACE%!
I let the fleet commander know I trust them to complete the operation without me. They have earned this bounty themselves.
Tracked %RACE% pirates across the %SYSTEM% Sector. Joined by %CAP_RACE% for the final confrontation. All hostiles destroyed. Substantial bounty claimed.
Tracked %RACE% pirates across the %SYSTEM% Sector. Cornered, the pirates fought tooth and nail. %CAP_RACE% unable to assist, and the fleet took heavy damage during the battle.
Tracked %RACE% pirates across the %SYSTEM% Sector. %CAP_RACE% gave us the honor of dealing the final blow. All hostiles destroyed. Substantial bounty claimed.

Good news, %CAP_RACE%. Our battle against piracy is proving highly successful!
We have destroyed several hostile capital ships, but the remaining fighters are proving awkward. Are you able to assist?
Excellent, %CAP_RACE%! I will have the fighter crews on standby, ready for your arrival!
Very well, %CAP_RACE%. I understand. I will direct the fighter crews as best as I am able.
Hunted %RACE% pirates across the %SYSTEM% System, assisted by the %CAP_RACE%. All hostiles destroyed. Large bounty claimed.
Hunted %RACE% pirates in the %SYSTEM% System. Pirates proved formidable foes, and the fleet was severely tested. %CAP_RACE% was unable to assist, and we took heavy damage.
Hunted %RACE% pirates in the %SYSTEM% System. The %CAP_RACE% was unable to assist, but the fleet triumphed regardless. All hostiles destroyed. Large bounty claimed.

%CAP_NAME%! Good news from the fleet! Our scanners have located a squadron of wanted %RACE% criminals. Their ships are small but well-armed, and our own pilots would perform much better knowing you were flying alongside them...
Excellent, %CAP_RACE%! The crew will be thrilled to have you fly alongside them!
Very well, %CAP_RACE%. I am certain the fighter crews will do their best regardless.
Pursued %RACE% pirates across the %SYSTEM% Sector. The %CAP_RACE% joined the fight, and inspired our fighter crews to victory. All hostiles destroyed. Substantial bounty claimed.
Pursued %RACE% pirates across the %SYSTEM% Sector. The fighter crews were nervous, and the pirates flew with great skill. Fleet lost several starships before deciding to withdraw.

Pursued %RACE% pirates across the %SYSTEM% Sector. %CAP_RACE% was unable to join the hunt, but the fighter crews performed excellently. All hostiles destroyed, claimed large reward from system authorities.

%CAP_RACE%, our scouts have located a notorious pirate chief. The prize on their head is substantial, of course, but the true prize is the glory that goes to the victor! It is only right to offer you the chance to claim it.
Offer the glory to the fleet
I tell the fleet commander that I am honored by their request. I shall try not to let them down.
I tell the fleet commander that they have earned the bounty, not me. They should be the ones to finish this.
Aided by the %CAP_RACE%, the fleet hunted and destroyed a notorious %RACE% pirate. Received substantial quantities of both bounty and glory.
Fleet located a %RACE% pirate, a terror of the interstellar shipping lanes. The %CAP_RACE% was unable to assist. Fugitive escaped.

The fleet hunted and destroyed a notorious %RACE% pirate, a terror of the interstellar shipping lanes. The %CAP_RACE% allowed the fleet to claim the kill, and we received substantial quantities of both bounty and glory.

I report a great triumph, %CAP_RACE%! We have cornered one of this sector's most wanted fugitives. All that remains is to best them in single combat!
Naturally, the crew wish to defer this honor to you. Do you accept?
It will be a privilege to watch you in action, %CAP_RACE%!
I understand, %CAP_RACE%. You cannot be everywhere. We will complete the mission regardless.
Joined by the %CAP_RACE% for a bounty hunt. The fleet hunted and destroyed a famous %RACE% pirate. Crew inspired by the %CAP_RACE%'s victory.
Fleet engaged a %RACE% pirate, notorious for their cunning in combat. The %CAP_RACE% was unable to assist, and the pirate destroyed several of our fighters before escaping.
Engaged in a bounty hunt. The fleet hunted and destroyed a famous %RACE% pirate, notorious for their cunning in combat. %CAP_RACE% unable to assist, but our fighter crews performed admirably.

Good news, %CAP_RACE%! Our patrol is proving highly lucrative! We have claimed many bounties, and are closing in on yet another.
This shall be our biggest prize yet. Come join us, %CAP_RACE%! It would thrill the crew to have you complete our patrol.
I tell the fleet commander I would be honored to join them in their mission. They salute as I end the communication.
I decline the offer. I tell the fleet commander that the crew has my confidence, and they do not need me. They salute as they end the communication.
Hunted bounties in the %SYSTEM% Sector. Minor prizes claimed, until the %CAP_RACE% joined the fleet. With their assistance, hunted and destroyed a particularly fearsome %RACE% pirate.
Hunted bounties in the %SYSTEM% Sector. Few prizes claimed before the fleet encountered a particularly fearsome %RACE% pirate. The %CAP_RACE% was unable to assist, and the fugitive escaped with ease.

Hunted bounties in the %SYSTEM% Sector. Minor prizes claimed, until the fleet encountered a particularly fearsome %RACE% pirate. The %CAP_RACE% deferred the glory to the fleet, and our fighter crews did not disappoint.

%CAP_RACE%, our spies have discovered a plot to take over a space station!
We could strike now, landing boarding shuttles and arresting the conspirators before they can act. But the risk to civilians would be high. What should we do?
Give the order to hold fire
I tell the fleet commander to attack. The risk to civilians would be even higher should the pirates take control of the space station.
I tell the fleet commander to avoid an assault. Alert the authorities, by all means, but they should not risk innocent lives by with an all-out attack.
Discovered a pirate plot in the %SYSTEM% System. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, deployed assault shuttles and destroyed hostile forces attempting to take over the space station. Operation successful.

Discovered a pirate plot in the %SYSTEM% System. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, deployed assault shuttles and destroyed hostile forces attempting to take over the space station. Plot foiled, but space station was destroyed in the process.
Discovered a pirate plot in the %SYSTEM% System. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, did not deploy assault team. Local %RACE% authorities successfully foiled plot.

Good news from the fleet, commander. We are in low orbit, holding station above a filthy pirate hub. Bombardment can begin on your word.
To attack, however, is to risk the ire of the Sentinels. %CAP_RACE%, we await your authorization.
I give the fleet commander instructions to attack. They are more than capable of dealing with any Sentinel retaliation.
I tell the fleet commander to withdraw. Stellar Sentinel forces are relentless in their pursuit. The fleet should look for easier bounties.
Encountered a pirate base on planet %PLANET%. Took advice from the %CAP_RACE% and began bombardment. Sentinel forces retaliated, but the fleet escaped without harm. Operation successful.
Encountered a pirate base on planet %PLANET%. Took advice from the %CAP_RACE% and began bombardment. Sentinel forces retaliated. Fleet took heavy fire and was forced to retreat.
Encountered a pirate base on planet %PLANET%. Took advice from the %CAP_RACE% and avoided conflict, hoping to remain hidden from the Sentinels.

%CAP_RACE%, the fleet salutes you!
We have stalked a mighty pirate all across the sector, never breaking stealth. But our stores are low, and the crew are getting hungry.
We are close to our goal. But on empty stomachs, I do not know how the crew will react. Do we continue?
Tell them to end the pursuit
I tell the fleet commander to continue the hunt. They may be hungry, but how will the crew feel if they give up and their efforts were for nothing?
I tell the fleet commander to end their chase. There will be other bounties. The health and loyalty of the crew is more important than any prize.
Stalked a pirate across the %SYSTEM% Sector. Forced to stay in low-heat signature mode to avoid detection. Despite difficult conditions, crew performed admirably. Hostiles destroyed.

Stalked a pirate across the %SYSTEM% Sector. Forced to stay in low-heat signature mode to avoid detection. Conditions became difficult, and the crew made several sloppy mistakes. Fugitive able to escape.

Stalked a pirate across the %SYSTEM% Sector. Forced to stay in low-heat signature mode to avoid detection. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, ended the chase when conditions became too difficult for the crew to operate safely.

%CAP_RACE%, the expedition requires your advice!
We are pursuing a bounty, and believe we have found our target. A vicious pirate, they have disguised themselves as a trader and are flying in formation with a merchant convoy.
We are almost certain we have identified the correct ship. Shall we attack?
I give the fleet commander the order to attack. I trust their judgement.
I tell the fleet commander to stay their attack. The consequences of destroying a civilian freighter would be dire indeed.
Hunted pirates in the %SYSTEM% System. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, picked off a notorious fugitive disguised as a merchant. Operation successful.
On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, attacked a suspected pirate disguised as a merchant vessel. Ship was misidentified. Local authorities responded to this attack on an innocent trader. Heavy damage taken.
Hunted pirates in the %SYSTEM% System. Made partial identification of notorious fugitive disguised as merchant. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, avoided a confrontation.

%CAP_RACE%, we require urgent advice! We have received a communication from a heavily-armed freighter group. But the signal is distorted, and we cannot make out their intentions.
What shall we do? Engage peacefully? Or arm the weapons?
I tell the commander to continue to hail the freighter, maintaining a peaceful stance.
I tell the commander to launch a preemptive attack. They cannot risk the safety of the expedition.
Encountered another expedition in the %SYSTEM% Sector. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, approached cautiously, hailing messages of peace. Other vessels were friendly. Valuable gifts exchanged.
Encountered another expedition in the %SYSTEM% Sector. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, approached cautiously, hailing messages of peace. Other vessels opened fire. Significant damage taken.
Encountered another expedition in the %SYSTEM% Sector. Unable to determine their intentions. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, deployed orbital weapons in all-out attack. All ships destroyed.

%CAP_RACE%, we need your advice! We have been approached by strange, organic-looking starships. They do not answer our hails.
The crew are worried, and we have primed our weapons. How should we respond?
I tell the fleet commander not to risk an attack. Treat the starships as if they were envoys of the local system authorities.
I tell the fleet commander not to risk the fleet. Raise shields and began the attack!
Encountered alien-looking starships in the %SYSTEM% Sector. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, sent messages on peace. Received strange signal in return. Signal translated into valuable technology data.
Encountered alien-looking starships in the %SYSTEM% Sector. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, sent messages on peace. Vessels responded with high-energy weapons. Heavy damage taken.
Encountered alien-looking starships in the %SYSTEM% Sector. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, armed weapons and attacked. Alien starships warped out instantaneously.

%CAP_RACE%! We require your advice!
Subsurface sonar reports a particularly large mineral deposit not far beneath the ground. However, analysis also suggests the earth is highly unstable.
Ground mining crew are standing by. Should we begin drilling?
I give the fleet commander the go-ahead. What is the purpose of these expeditions, if not to explore the earth and gain its treasure?
I tell the fleet commander not to take the risk. There are plenty of accessible minerals without having to venture into unstable caves.
Found high-value mineral deposits in geologically unstable area. Began mining after taking advice from the %CAP_RACE%. Crew probed and avoided potential fault-lines. Operation successful.
Found high-value mineral deposits in geologically unstable area. Took advice from the %CAP_RACE%and avoided drilling in dangerous terrain.

Found high-value mineral deposits in geologically unstable area. Began mining after taking advice from the %CAP_RACE%. Crew hit fault-lines while drilling, cave collapsed. Ground crew lost, along with valuable equipment.

%CAP_RACE%, the expedition requires urgent assistance! Our mining operations attracted the attention of the Sentinels!
We have evacuated the ground crew, but Sentinel starships have pursued the fleet into space. Please, help us!

%CAP_RACE%, the fleet requires your help! We were harvesting far-orbit asteroids when were attacked by Sentinels!
We are attempting to hold them off, but their attacks are relentless! Please, we require immediate rescue!

%CAP_RACE%, disaster has struck the fleet! We mined too deep, stole too many precious minerals!
The Sentinels have come for us, and we are surely doomed... unless... you are able to save us?
I reassure the fleet commander. I will be there soon.
I tell the fleet commander I cannot help them. They must warp away as soon as possible.
Attacked by Sentinel forces after extensive mining in the %SYSTEM% Sector. %CAP_RACE% came to our defense. Fleet escaped with all cargo.
Attacked by Sentinel forces after extensive mining in the %SYSTEM% Sector. %CAP_RACE% unable to defend the fleet. Cargo pods destroyed, heavy damage taken.
Attacked by Sentinel forces after extensive mining in the %SYSTEM% Sector. Jettisoned collected minerals to lose weight. Made quick warp out of the system.

%CAP_RACE%. I hope this message finds you well. The fleet has arrived at a highly-lucrative mineral field in the %SYSTEM% Sector.
We face a choice: to mine at the surface and battle the elements; or to drill into the earth and take our chances in the deep underground.
Understood, %CAP_RACE%. I shall see to it that the miners are well-protected.
Very well, %CAP_RACE%. We will prepare the drilling rig immediately.
Began mining in the %SYSTEM% System. The %CAP_RACE% advised surface-based operations. Environmental shielding deployed to great effect. Operation successful.
Began mining in the %SYSTEM% System. The %CAP_RACE% advised surface-based operations. Hazardous environmental conditions overwhelmed the crew, dissolving their equipment. Operation aborted.
Began mining in the %SYSTEM% System. The %CAP_RACE% advised deep-level mining. Specialist crew deployed, rich mineral seams discovered. Operation successful.
Began mining in the %SYSTEM% System. The %CAP_RACE% advised deep-level mining. Planet stability compromised. Tunnel collapse caused catastrophic loss of equipment, some crew.

%CAP_RACE%, greetings from the %SYSTEM% Sector.
We have found a particularly rich asteroid field, each rock a feast of precious metal! But the field is crowded with starships. We risk upsetting the %RACE% miners already at work. What should we do?
I tell them to go for it. Hope they'll be ok.
I tell the fleet commander not to upset local miners. There will be other mineral fields.

Arrived in a busy mineral field in the outer %SYSTEM% Sector. Began operations on advice of the %CAP_RACE%. Despite some protests by local miners, gathered and processed substantial volume of valuable metal.
Arrived in a busy mineral field in the outer %SYSTEM% Sector. Began operations on advice of the %CAP_RACE%. Local miners objected to the intrusion and deployed weapons. Retreated.
Arrived in a busy mineral field in the outer %SYSTEM% Sector. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, left local miners in peace. Began search for alternative sites.

%CAP_RACE%, our salvage crews have made a very special discovery. They have located an extremely rare starship, abandoned and empty on the planet's surface.
Join us in the %SYSTEM% System at once, and claim it for yourself!

%CAP_RACE%, greetings from your fleet! We have reached the %SYSTEM% Sector.
Our salvage recovery drones have spotted an abandoned starship of particular interest. A rare model, it deserves more than the scrapheap. Come claim it for yourself, %CAP_RACE%!

%CAP_RACE%. The expedition proceeds smoothly.
Here in the %SYSTEM% System, among the metal mines and processing plants of the %RACE%, our salvage team have made a special discovery. A rare starship, abandoned and empty! Come, join us and claim it!
Very well, %CAP_RACE%. I shall send you the coordinates immediately.
I thank the commander for their thoughtfulness. However, I already have all the starships I need.
Located an exotic starship in the %SYSTEM% System. Pinpointed the location so the %CAP_RACE% could collect it.
Located an exotic starship in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% did not need it, so deployed salvage crews to recover and recycle the vessel.

%CAP_RACE%, the expedition goes well, but we require your assistance.
Our geologists require your assistance! The mining team have collected several rare ores, but we are struggling to analyze them. Perhaps if you were able to find some comparative data?

Greetings, %CAP_RACE%. Our geology team has requested your assistance.
They are busy analyzing a fresh sample, but require a larger data set to work from. They respectfully request you assist them by acquiring detailed mineral scans.
Tell them to the buy data
Thank you, %CAP_RACE%. We look forward to receiving the data.
I instruct the fleet commander to purchase data locally. The local Explorers Guild will be able to help.
Discovered novel mineral type in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% assisted with research. Minerals proved highly valuable.
Discovered novel mineral type in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% advised local Explorers Guild may assist with research. Found willing researcher, minerals proved highly valuable.
Discovered novel mineral type in the %SYSTEM% System. %CAP_RACE% advised local Explorers Guild may assist with research. Minerals proved valuable, but Guild payments were steep. Little profit made.

Greetings, %CAP_RACE%. We have made excellent progress, and are now in the %SYSTEM% System, an area of %RACE%-controlled space. The minerals here are rich and plentiful.
That is not the subject at hand, however. We have encountered a strange energy disturbance, which analysis suggests is a wormhole. If you desire, we could calibrate it to your signal, pulling you to our location instantly.
I accept the offer. The fleet commander looks slightly nervous, but turns to prepare their systems.
I decline to be a test subject for this supposed wormhole. The fleet commander appears slightly relieved.
Encountered a wormhole in %RACE%-controlled space. Calibrated the anomaly to the %CAP_RACE%'s signal and transported them to our location.
Encountered a wormhole in %RACE%-controlled space. Offered the %CAP_RACE% the opportunity to join the fleet via wormhole transport, but they declined the offer.

Greetings, %CAP_RACE%. The mission has proceeded smoothly to the %SYSTEM% System, an area of %RACE% space. We have mined deep, and profited greatly!
But we have observed a strange energy disturbance, which we are 99% certain is a wormhole. If you desire, we could calibrate it to your signal, pulling you to our location instantly.
I accept the offer. A fleeting worried look passes over the commander's face as they turn to their chief engineer. I begin to regret my decision...
I decline the commander's offer. The minerals may be valuable, but I am content to let the fleet extract them without my being sent through a wormhole.

Greetings from the %SYSTEM% System, %CAP_RACE%! Local %RACE% authorities have been cooperative, and our salvage teams have made great profits.
But this system is full of strange energy disturbances. They appear to be wormholes, and analysis suggests we could tune one to your signal. Will you join us? The process will be instantaneous.
I accept the commander's 'offer'. It will be good to see their ships again. As the signal fades, I see the commander glance down at a data readout, a look of concern on their face...
I decline the offer. I tell the commander that I have great faith in their ability, and do not need to come check up on them. Particularly via an untested wormhole.

Greetings, %CAP_RACE%. Our mining teams have a dilemma, and they look to you for advice.
The planet %PLANET% is full of mineral-rich magma. Each gallon is a valuable prize. But how deep should we drill? How much should we risk for this profit?

I give the fleet commander specific instructions. The miners are to act with caution, taking measurements as they drill. Magma may be rich in minerals, but having it flood the tunnels is highly undesirable.
I tell the fleet commander to drill deep, to be a pioneer of the depths. There is much to be won, both in mineral wealth and scientific discovery.
Began deep-level mining operations on planet %PLANET%. On advice of the %CAP_RACE%, took great caution when working near magma veins. Work was slow, but moderately profitable.
Began deep-level mining operations on planet %PLANET%. With encouragement of the %CAP_RACE%, sunk tunnels to unprecedented depths. Harvested vast amount of mineral-rich magma.
Began deep-level mining operations on planet %PLANET%. With encouragement of the %CAP_RACE%, sunk tunnels to unprecedented depths. Walls collapsed, tunnels flooded with superheated magma.

%CAP_RACE%, I bring bad news from the %SYSTEM% System.
One of our mining teams has been lost in a tunnel collapse. The entire area has become unstable. We could send a second team in to mount a rescue, but it is fraught with risk. What should we do?
I tell the fleet commander to prepare a rescue immediately. Leave no-one behind.
With regret, I tell the fleet commander to withdraw. Sending more crew headlong into danger will only cost more lives.
Tunnel collapsed while mining on planet %PLANET%. Deployed rescue team on advice from the %CAP_RACE%. Operation highly successful: recovered both the crew and the minerals they gathered.

Tunnel collapsed while mining on planet %PLANET%. Deployed rescue team on advice from the %CAP_RACE%. Planetary seismic activity remained high, and the rescue crew was also lost to the shifting earth.
Tunnel collapsed while mining on planet %PLANET%. Consulted the %CAP_RACE% and evacuated rather than risk further lives in a rescue. Mining crew lost.

%CAP_RACE%, it is good to see you. The expedition goes well, but we have a difficult decision to make. I need your advice.
Our salvage crew have located a crashed freighter. But they are afraid to begin processing. They claim the ship is haunted, and do not wish to step inside.
I tell the %CAP_RACE% to order the crew into the wreck. Whatever is 'haunting' the ship is likely to be highly valuable technology.
